6.0 Planned Changes to Improve Safety [40 CFR 68.155(f)]
Franklin is dedicated to providing a safe environment not only for our employees but also for our neighbors and community. There are efforts in place to improve the safety and overall RMP program to strengthen the Columbus site. Franklin is committed to addressing any concerns in a timely manner and maintains communication with the community.

ension used in many products manufactured the site. The facility stores greater than 15,000 pounds of vinyl acetate monomer, which is the threshold quantity (TQ) that triggers applicability to 40 CFR 68. Thus, 40 CFR 68 is applicable to the Columbus facility.
The dominant characteristic of vinyl acetate is its toxicity. Vinyl acetate is highly flammable and can form toxic vapors in the air. It is not poisonous, but it is an irritant to human tissue as well as a suspected
April 2022 Page 2 of 2
carcinogen. Vinyl Acetate is most dangerous when inhaled especially in high concentrations which can cause irritation the respiratory tract.
3.0 General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps [40 CFR 68.155(c)]
The vinyl acetate is shipped in liquid form and transferred to underground storage tanks. The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies are addressed in the individual RMP procedures which detail the RMP program requirements as well as how Franklin complies with the applicable requirements.
4.0 Five-year Accident History [40 CFR 68.155(d)]
Franklin International has an excellent record of preventing accidental releases over the last 5 years. Due to our release prevention policies, there has been no accidental release as defined in 40 CFR 68.42(a) during this period.
5.0 Emergency Response Program [40 CFR 68.155(e)]
The Columbus facility has an Emergency Response Plan (ERP). The ERP describes response procedures to minimize hazards to human health and the environment in the event of release. As backup, Franklin has also contracted with an outside firm who is capable of responding to large chemical releases. In addition, Franklin has coordinated with local emergency response units and share information about our facility layout and hazardous chemicals on site with them on a regular basis. We periodically conduct evacuation drills to maintain a high-level awareness among our employees. All Franklin personnel receive

This is an executive summary of the policies, procedures, and activities for compliance with the EPA's Accidental Release Prevention Requirements - Risk Management Program pursuant to Title 40 Part 68 of the Code of Federal Regulations (40 CFR 68) for Franklin International Columbus, OH facility.
1.0 Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies [40 CFR 68.155(a)]
Franklin International has a policy to comply with the letter and the spirit of the laws applicable to our processes and products, as well as meet or exceed other accepted standards. Facility management regards employee and public safety as a very serious matter and have taken several precautions to maintain a safe working and public environment. The Columbus facility has an excellent record in preventing releases of vinyl acetate and has a thorough safety and emergency procedure in place at the site. This facility has implemented a closed loop transfer with vapor recovery devices which minimizes discharge of hazardous vapor to the air and the raw material is shipped in liquid form to underground storage tanks to further prevent release. The facility implemented a chemical inhibitor in the vinyl acetate to ensure that a reaction does not occur.
The emergency response policies at the Columbus facility ensure that there is emergency response coverage 24 hours  7 days per week. There are also adequate provisions for coordination with outside agencies such as with the Columbus Fire Department in the event of an emergency.
2.0 Process Description and Regulated Substances [40 CFR 68.155(b)]
Franklin International is located at 2020 Bruck St, in Columbus, OH. The Columbus facility is an adhesive and sealant manufacturer. The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for the primary process at this facility is (32552The Columbus facility has one regulated substance under 40 CFR 68: vinyl acetate.
